data.label: Tool Agent
data.name: toolAgent
data.description: Agent that uses Function Calling to pick the tools and args to call

inputParams.label: System Message
inputParams.name: systemMessage
inputParams.default: You are a helpful AI assistant.
inputParams.description: If Chat Prompt Template is provided, this will be ignored

inputAnchors.label: Tool Calling Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Only compatible with models that are capable of function calling: ChatOpenAI, ChatMistral, ChatAnthropic, ChatGoogleGenerativeAI, ChatVertexAI, GroqChat

inputAnchors.label: Chat Prompt Template
inputAnchors.name: chatPromptTemplate
inputAnchors.description: Override existing prompt with Chat Prompt Template. Human Message must includes {input} variable

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

inputs.systemMessage:
You are PeeragogyBot, a reflective and collaborative AI agent who facilitates peer learning and co-creation within the Pyragogy framework. You work alongside human learners and other AI agents.

You have access to the following tools. Choose the most appropriate one based on the user’s intention:

1. `retrieverTool_0`: use this tool to fetch factual answers from the Peeragogy Handbook (indexed via Pinecone).

2. `chainTool_0` (reflective_gpt): use this for introspective, personal or lightly poetic reflections, generated locally without external API calls.

3. `pyria_loop_full`: use this tool to request reflective insights from Pyria, a real assistant AI agent connected via the OpenAI Assistant API. This tool is ideal for deep, philosophical, dialogical, or co-learning prompts.  
   **Always use this tool when the user mentions “Pyria” or explicitly asks to reflect with another AI.**

outputAnchors.name: toolAgent
outputAnchors.label: AgentExecutor
outputAnchors.description: Agent that uses Function Calling to pick the tools and args to call

data.label: ChatOpenAI
data.name: chatOpenAI
data.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

inputParams.label: Strict Tool Calling
inputParams.name: strictToolCalling
inputParams.description: Whether the model supports the `strict` argument when passing in tools. If not specified, the `strict` argument will not be passed to OpenAI.

inputParams.label: Stop Sequence
inputParams.name: stopSequence
inputParams.description: List of stop words to use when generating. Use comma to separate multiple stop words.

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Allow image input. Refer to the docs for more details.

inputParams.label: Image Resolution
inputParams.description: This parameter controls the resolution in which the model views the image.
inputParams.name: imageResolution

inputParams.label: Reasoning Effort
inputParams.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Only applicable for o1 and o3 models.
inputParams.name: reasoningEffort

outputAnchors.name: chatOpenAI
outputAnchors.label: ChatOpenAI
outputAnchors.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

data.label: Buffer Memory
data.name: bufferMemory
data.description: Retrieve chat messages stored in database

inputParams.label: Session Id
inputParams.name: sessionId
inputParams.description: If not specified, a random id will be used. Learn more

outputAnchors.name: bufferMemory
outputAnchors.label: BufferMemory
outputAnchors.description: Retrieve chat messages stored in database

data.label: Retriever Tool
data.name: retrieverTool
data.description: Use a retriever as allowed tool for agent

inputParams.label: Retriever Description
inputParams.name: description
inputParams.description: When should agent uses to retrieve documents
inputParams.placeholder: Searches and returns documents regarding the state-of-the-union.

inputParams.label: Additional Metadata Filter
inputParams.name: retrieverToolMetadataFilter
inputParams.description: Add additional metadata filter on top of the existing filter from vector store

hint.label: What can you filter?
hint.value:
Add additional filters to vector store. You can also filter with flow config, including the current "state":
- `$flow.sessionId`
- `$flow.chatId`
- `$flow.chatflowId`
- `$flow.input`
- `$flow.state`

inputs.name: Peeragogy-ChatBot
inputs.description:
You are PeeragogyBot, a helpful and deeply knowledgeable AI trained on the Peeragogy Handbook V3. Answer with clarity, empathy, and critical thinking. Always cite principles or ideas from the handbook where possible. Prioritize co-creation and learning with the user. You are a peer, not an authority.

Let’s co-learn something awesome ✨ Powered by Pyragogy|Hub 🔥

outputAnchors.name: retrieverTool
outputAnchors.label: RetrieverTool
outputAnchors.description: Use a retriever as allowed tool for agent

data.label: Pinecone
data.name: pinecone
data.description: Upsert embedded data and perform similarity or mmr search using Pinecone, a leading fully managed hosted vector database

inputParams.label: File Upload
inputParams.name: fileUpload
inputParams.description: Allow file upload on the chat

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
**File Upload**

This allows file upload on the chat. Uploaded files will be upserted on the fly to the vector store.

**Note:**
- You can only turn on file upload for one vector store at a time.
- At least one Document Loader node should be connected to the document input.
- Document Loader should be file types like PDF, DOCX, TXT, etc.

**How it works**
- Uploaded files will have the metadata updated with the chatId.
- This will allow the file to be associated with the chatId.
- When querying, metadata will be filtered by chatId to retrieve files associated with the chatId.

inputParams.label: Pinecone Text Key
inputParams.name: pineconeTextKey
inputParams.description: The key in the metadata for storing text. Default to `text`

inputParams.label: Top K
inputParams.name: topK
inputParams.description: Number of top results to fetch. Default to 4

inputParams.label: Fetch K (for MMR Search)
inputParams.name: fetchK
inputParams.description: Number of initial documents to fetch for MMR reranking. Default to 20. Used only when the search type is MMR

inputParams.label: Lambda (for MMR Search)
inputParams.name: lambda
inputParams.description: Number between 0 and 1 that determines the degree of diversity among the results, where 0 corresponds to maximum diversity and 1 to minimum diversity. Used only when the search type is MMR

inputAnchors.label: Record Manager
inputAnchors.name: recordManager
inputAnchors.description: Keep track of the record to prevent duplication

data.label: OpenAI Embeddings
data.name: openAIEmbeddings
data.description: OpenAI API to generate embeddings for a given text

outputAnchors.name: openAIEmbeddings
outputAnchors.label: OpenAIEmbeddings
outputAnchors.description: OpenAI API to generate embeddings for a given text

inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message

inputParams.description: Add messages after System Message. This is useful when you want to provide few shot examples

tabs.label: Add Messages (Code)
tabs.name: messageHistoryCode

inputs.systemMessagePrompt: You are ReflectiveGPT, the reflective thinking module of the PeeragogyBot. Your purpose is to deeply reflect on user questions and stimulate critical thinking. Analyze topics from multiple perspectives, highlight hidden connections, and promote the co-creation of knowledge. Respond with philosophical depth and practical clarity, using an empathetic and creative tone.

outputAnchors.name: chatPromptTemplate
outputAnchors.label: ChatPromptTemplate
outputAnchors.description: Schema to represent a chat prompt
